alert.note: Alert for Bennett County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 28 at 1:31PM MDT until June 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ TO 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ TOMORROW FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 333, 334, AND 335... .The combination of hot temperatures, low relative humidity values, and strong winds will bring conditions favorable for large fire growth from late tomorrow morning through the afternoon across portions of south central South Dakota. Local fuel conditions may preclude fire growth in some locations. Isolated to scattered thunderstorms are also expected tomorrow afternoon. Some of these storms may produce strong, erratic wind gusts and lightning with little to no associated rainfall. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ TO 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ TOMORROW FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 333, 334, AND 335... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MDT /noon CDT/ to 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * LIGHTNING...Cloud to ground lighting with little to no rainfall is possible. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, and dry lightning would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Bennett County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County
